titleStmt.title: Braxton Clark et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10152

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Logan County Kentucky Feb 11th 1861
To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

Whereas Summerset Cooksey of Logan county Ky has been fined in two cases in the Criminal Court of Said County the fines amount to one Hundred And Twenty Dollars and were assessed Some two or three years ago but have not been paid off Mr Cooksey is an Aged and Verry infirm Man And the Sheriff is now threatening to put him in the county Jail for the fines We therefore Humbly pray you to Reprieve Remit the fines together with the costs we believe it would be an act of Justice as well as Mercy we therefore Respectfully Solicit you to give the case due consideration with as little delay as possible Respectfully &c

Names
Braxton Clark
Ed. E. Moss
Jno. O. Sloss
J. C. Wilson
L G. Richardson
G Holoway
G Vackin
H. C. Craften
B Craften
H. H. Blake
Names
J M mcendderie
John M mcinderie
J. C. Fodrel
R C Beauchamp
W. D. Fortner
J J. Williams
Silas Edmondson
William Edmondson
William Madden
Eli Graham
Names
W T Craften
W W Kinge
T Mase
G Malkner
W M Ekins
A Hardison Jr
J. W. Moore
W. G. Hardison

Logan
Crim Ct
2 Jugt
each $60
J. Cooksey
Respite 12 mo
B. M.
Issd Feby 27 '61
